1.Cons: Sometimes I couldn't finish my McFlurry in time.

2.Pros: They offer part timeThey have flexible hours
2.Cons: They only pay you part time at the most just under the 40 hours required by law so they won't have to pay you benefits.

3.Pros: You have a chance to grow/be promoted.Hours start off strongBreak time is your preference, as long as you're not gone too long
3.Cons: Two out of about five or six managers were completely out of line, one liked to snap and call you "what's-your-face" and will also turn to other coworkers and speak in Spanish as if I don't understand that she is talking about me.Can have rude customers but that is expected with a job.I was not given a chance to grow. I assume this is because when the company sees who they want to promote then that's who all the hours go to. I started working 40 hours a week during the summer, but then only worked one day a week as I continued to work there.
